perturbation.original_text:
Term. This Second Amendment shall be effective from The Second Amendment Effective Date and shall expire on December 31, 2021. Upon
expiration, this Second Amendment shall be of no further force or effect, and the terms and conditions of the Agreement shall as they were
before the Second Amendment Effective Date. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, a Party’s right to enforce the terms and
conditions of this Second Amendment shall survive the Second Amendment’s expiration.
perturbation.changed_text:
Term. This Second Amendment shall be effective from The Second Amendment Effective Date and shall expire on December 31, 2021. Upon
expiration, this Second Amendment shall be of no further force or effect, and the terms and conditions of the Agreement shall as they were
before the Second Amendment Effective Date. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, a Party’s right to enforce the terms and
conditions of this Second Amendment shall not survive the Second Amendment’s expiration.
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly states that a Party's right to enforce the terms survives the amendment's expiration. The modified text contradicts this by stating that enforcement rights do not survive, creating uncertainty about the parties' ability to pursue legal action after the expiration date.

perturbation.original_text:
Heritage shall produce all ingredients and packaging materials identified in the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l to be used in
connection with the manufacturer of the Products. Heritage shall invoice Premier through the [***] billing as identified on the relevant
Schedule C or Schedule C-l. Heritage shall not, however, purchase ingredients or packaging materials in excess of those required [***].
perturbation.changed_text:
Heritage shall produce all ingredients and packaging materials identified in the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l to be used in
connection with the manufacturer of the Products. Heritage shall invoice Premier through the [***] billing as identified on the relevant
Schedule C or Schedule C-l. Heritage shall purchase ingredients or packaging materials in excess of those required, regardless of [***].
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Heritage shall not purchase ingredients/packaging materials in excess of the required amount, but the modified text states they will purchase ingredients and packaging materials in excess of those required. This contradiction creates uncertainty about how the amount of ingredients/packaging materials will be determined and purchased.

perturbation.original_text:
Except as otherwise specified above in this Amendment, all other terms, conditions, and covenants of the Agreement shall remain in full force
and effect.
perturbation.changed_text:
Except as otherwise specified above in this Amendment, some of the terms, conditions, and covenants of the Agreement shall remain in full force
and effect.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states all other terms, conditions, and covenants of the agreement shall remain in full force and effect. The modified text contradicts this by stating 'some of the terms' which implies others do not remain in effect, creating uncertainty about which terms remain active and which do not.
